lines.text: I see you're a scholar, my son, as well as a traveler.
Certainly a traveler, Father. I've sailed as far north as Iceland, as far south as Guinea, and eastward to the Golden Horn.
But that is to have reached the limits of the World.
Of the known world? Yes, Father, but the actual world... not by a thousand leagues.
How can you say that - never having seen it?
Have you ever seen Heaven or Hell?
We have sound reasons for believing they exist.
The same as yours, Father, and revelations to which I can add cosmography and mathematics.

[as he and Diego observe a native smoking tobacco]
Doesn't that prove how backward they are? You never see a civilized man do that.
